title.narrative: Life saving food and livelihood support to drought affected communities in Sheikh, Togdheer region, Somaliland

description.narrative: The project aims at responding to the food insecurity problems among drought affected agro pastoral communities in Sheikh, Togdheer region. The project directly targets an estimated 3882 individuals (IDPs/ Returnees, Host and agro-pastoral communities) particularly women, children the elderly and other highly vulnerable people in Cagaaray, Calaacule, Gidil, Gugux and Suuqsade villages. The project will aim to support the affected households to meet their immediate food and cash needs, as well as provide appropriate capacity building to the target communities. In order to respond to immediate food requirements, Cash Based Interventions will be used. 550 households (HH) selected from the target villages will receive Unconditional Cash Transfers (UCT) for three months while 200 able bodied men and women will also benefit from cash for work interventions. The rationale for utilizing conditional and unconditional transfers will enable households to access a diversified food basket from their local markets as well as meeting other priority non-food needs. This will improve food intake (frequency of meals and dietary diversity) while at the same time reducing negative coping mechanisms. Priority will be given to child-headed households without other forms of support households headed by disabled persons or elderly persons without support poor female-headed households poor households with malnourished children and poor pregnant and lactating women who are at increased risk of malnutrition. Cash for Work (CfW) will be used to construct or rehabilitate community infrastructure, and help to ensure that targeted households have access to the cash needed to purchase food and other basic items and services. Activities to be undertaken will include Soil and Water Conservation (contour/ soil bands), rangeland rehabilitation, feeder roads and water source rehabilitation all of which enhance community owned assets. Furthermore, 50 agro-pastoral households will be supported with training in improved dryland farming techniques including conservation agriculture and post-harvest handling of crop produce. They will be provided with farm inputs - high quality and tested seeds (maize, sorghum, cow-peas, water melon, onions, tomatoes, sweet and hot pepper) and tillage hours, targeting the upcoming Gu and or Karan rainy season. 11 water resources including 8 birkards and 3 shallow wells will be rehabilitated to provide water for animal and human consumption and crop production where possible. The 9 months project will have three components including 1. Conditional and Unconditional cash transfers 2. Agricultural production and income support 3. Water sources rehabilitation.
